framework_context.description: Holistic Problem-Solving is a specific domain that exemplifies the practical application of knowledge in real-world contexts, integrating theoretical understanding with practical experience. It is part of the Practical Wisdom domain, which focuses on the application of knowledge in real-world scenarios. This topic also reflects the Interdisciplinary Synthesis process by integrating knowledge from multiple domains to form a comprehensive understanding of complex problems.

key_concepts.name: Interdisciplinary Integration
key_concepts.explanation: The process of combining insights from various disciplines to address complex problems, ensuring a comprehensive understanding.

key_concepts.name: Holistic Approach
key_concepts.explanation: Considering the interconnectedness of all aspects of a problem, rather than focusing on isolated components.

key_concepts.name: Contextual Understanding
key_concepts.explanation: Recognizing the importance of situational factors in problem-solving, including social, cultural, and environmental contexts.

major_principles.name: Systems Thinking
major_principles.description: Understanding complex systems as interconnected networks rather than isolated parts, facilitating a more comprehensive approach to problem-solving.

major_principles.name: Iterative Learning
major_principles.description: Embracing a cyclical process of problem-solving where solutions are continuously refined based on new information and feedback.

major_principles.name: Collaborative Effort
major_principles.description: Encouraging teamwork and diverse perspectives to leverage the strengths of different individuals and disciplines.

relationships.connection: Holistic Problem-Solving integrates knowledge from multiple domains to address complex problems, exemplifying the Interdisciplinary Synthesis process.
Holistic Problem-Solving is a key application of Practical Wisdom, focusing on the practical application of knowledge in real-world contexts.
The cognitive processes involved in holistic problem-solving, such as perception, attention, and memory, are studied within Cognitive Science.

implications.broader_impact: Enhanced understanding of complex systems and their interconnectedness.
implications.description: Holistic Problem-Solving contributes to a deeper understanding of how different components interact within systems, leading to more effective solutions.

implications.broader_impact: Improved collaboration and communication across disciplines.
implications.description: By emphasizing interdisciplinary integration and collaborative effort, holistic problem-solving fosters better communication and cooperation among experts from various fields.

implications.broader_impact: Development of more adaptive and resilient problem-solving strategies.
implications.description: The iterative learning principle inherent in holistic problem-solving encourages continuous improvement and adaptation, leading to more resilient solutions.
